title: Understanding Sorting Orders
text: When sorting data, there are two main orders to consider: ascending and descending. Ascending order means arranging data from smallest to largest, earliest to latest, or alphabetically from A to Z. Descending order is the opposite.

title: Identifying Descending Order
text: Descending order involves arranging data from highest to lowest, most recent to earliest, or alphabetically from Z to A. This is often used when you want to prioritize the largest or most recent items.

title: Choosing the Correct Order
text: Given the options of ascending and descending order, which one aligns with sorting data from highest to lowest, most recent to earliest, or alphabetically from Z to A?
